sentence.Network_en: The tooth hung dangling by the bedpost, now.
sentence.Network_cn: 结果,那颗牙就晃来晃去吊在床柱上了.

sentence.Network_en: He would cut it down in the twinkling of a bedpost.
She went to the bedpost near the head of Holofernes and taking his sword from it.
sentence.Network_cn: 她走到靠敖罗斐乃头部的床柱前,由上面取下了他的关刀.

entry.def: A bedpost is one of the four vertical supports at the corners of a bed with an old-fashioned wooden or iron frame.

means.word_mean: 1. any of 4 vertical supports at the corners of a bedstead
